titleStmt.title: Sebastian C. Vick to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG12031

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.collection: 37th - 76th Regiments Enrolled Militia Primary Source Documents (1861-1866)
msIdentifier.idno: Box 81, Folder 71st Regiemnt 1863-1865 Col. Vick's Correspondences

body.p:
Head quarters 71st Ky. E. M.
Greenville Ky. June the 18' 1864
Thos.E. Bramlett } 10 Ky
Gov. of the commonwealth

Sir I have the pleasure of droping a note to you this morning I have just Reach.d. Greenville with a detachment of 150, of the 35 Regt, Ky. Mt,d. Inf. the green River country Is full of guirillars. We Start Incidialy after them I will Report to you and Gen. Lindsey. Soon & =

Govornor Believe me to yours
Very rispectfuly
Sebastian. C. Vick
Col comd.g. 71st E. M.

71st regt E. M. Muhlenburg Co
Greenville June 18, 1864

Vick. S. C. Col Comdg 71st regt E M has the pleasure of dropping a line to the Govr. Has just reached Greenville with 150 of 35th Ky Mtd Infty The Green River Country is full of guerillas & they start after them immediately, will report soon to Govr & Genl Lindsey. His Exclncy referd this to I. G. O.
